abstract: Military officials and experts blame faulty intelligence and 'fog of war,' or battlefield confusion, for high number of errant airstrikes and resulting civilian casualties in Afghanistan and Middle East wars; say mistakes, which draw outrage in target countries, are inevitable whenever airstrikes used.

headline.print_headline: When Airstrikes Go Awry, Faulty Intelligence and ‘Fog of War’ Are Usually to Blame
headline.main: It’s Not Like Hollywood: Why U.S. Airstrikes Go Awry

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Military officers and experts say that almost all mistaken American strikes over the years have come down to two main reasons: faulty intelligence and battlefield confusion....
lead_paragraph: Military officers and experts say that almost all mistaken American strikes over the years have come down to two main reasons: faulty intelligence and battlefield confusion.
